messages.content: its a good event
either some souls or card remove
someone reminded me yesterday that taking this event act 1 and choosing intimidate unlocks the sequel in act 2 where he gets bodyguards (2 centurions from the centurion/mystic fight)
I treat it as a free remove
and if you win that you get DOUBLE REMOVE
so I can go for the protection event in act 2
for an EMPTY CAGE
downfall events stronk
but i love the flavor. and being stronk isn't terrible for a mod. it's often very fun if done correctly
yes
having a strong deck that destroys every fight can get boring, but events can be strong without pushing you that far over the OP line
i certainly prefer downfall events to base game forgotten altar :^)

that said, the fact that downfall forgotten altar is stronger on high ascension is a bit weird
i figured it was an oversight
I don't like this event because it is a no brainer. 95% of time removal is better and it costs nothing
It's also maybe the most blatant example of the downfall events being stronger
that's true, the souls are especially mediocre at high ascension
At least for the original you're sometimes low on hp or gold
also isnt the remove more cost efficient?
since base remove price is 75
+25 each time
yes
meaning that taking the remove saves you 100 or more souls
I would only take the souls if I had like 260 souls
because then I could by a strong rare relic
current example. Old grem wheel and card match grems was way better before it was (rightfully) nerfed

I do think that for this event, it's a little strong but that's fine, I just treat it as a second card removal shrine. The rematch though is a little too much, 2 card removals from 1 event is too much, and I don't consider 2 centurions to be hard enough for that.

A few ways you could go about that:

1) Just make the rematch still only remove 1.

2) Buff the centurions in some way

3) (my personal decision) buff the centurions a lot more, but give an option to just run away and skip it. I don't like how the fight is forced upon you, since double centurions is pretty tough.
I've lost a few runs to the rematch because of being forced to fight a fight of similar difficulty to an elite with 0 warning.
I've never seen the rematch
~~three centurions~~
you know the feeling of being jumpscared by a fight on a ? spot?
yeah 2 centurions is that
but worse

Nah that's not a metaphor, a metaphor is an exaggeration used to compare two things. This is a shifty man giving you needles that get you high (strength) and hurt you.
oh shit I love LYKABITTOS AYKABHTTO£
wait that's a Euro
ikea furniture type name
wait that's in Nicosia, Cyprus
*Nic*osia

It's a good event that you're happy to see, slightly better than the card remove shrine since sometimes the other option will be better (membership card, courier, a store is coming up really soon, you are very close to having enough souls to buy a rare relic from an upcoming shop). You should pick the remove the majority of the time, since it makes your deck immediately better, and removing a card costs 75 souls if you wait until later to do it at a shop (and each time you remove a card that way, the cost goes up by 25 souls). I haven't run into the 2 centurions fight, but it sounds like a very strong reward if you do get to it. 

I don't really mind that this (and other) downfall events are stronger/better than many events from the base game. What I mind more is that missing element of risk/reward and decision making. The real problem is that too many downfall events have a very obvious correct choice, and don't require carefully weighing risks (how hard will this fight be, can I afford to lose this much health right now, can I afford to take a curse) with their rewards. It's okay for the downfall events to be better on average, but nerfing the rewards from fights like gremlin wheel was a step in the right direction.
I think the guy should get a hug.
Do you get high enough to imagine ||Ghost Shields||?
NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
WE WERE SO CLOSE
TO FINALLY BEING ABLE TO HAVE THE "Discussions since last Ghost Shield mention" counter hit one
well now it's zero
I hope you're happy with this
idk why the punch option is even here. I've seen this event at least a hundred times and never even considered clicking it.
50 gold vs a card removal is completely messed up. If you take the card removal you even get a chance to remove another 2 cards later
I feel like punch is only viable low ascension, even then its a tough sell
Yeah I do think that on high ascension they should make the intimidate option have some sort of downside
^ Yeah I Think some downside could be interesting

I like the bodyguard idea from the rematch, but maybe it's just too much, maybe merge that into the first fight and have it be a percentage for a fight as well (increased chance of fight on higher ascension)
because the card removal as people have explained is like always the choice here period; saving money in removing cards in shop, and takes an event square instead of a shop/bonfire tile
removing a card over taking an engagement to get another card is almost always the play
I think this and the shrine events are probably the last of the OP events that don't have much risk.
yeah sure

Downfall events in general have slightly more card removal so curses aren't even as bad, and downfall curses usually aren't horrible (slimed is a better injury, bewildered is rough but can be worked around in a few ways, which is uncharacteristic for a curse, worse one is probably the turn your hand to status or fill your hand with echos ones)

so taking the desecrate option on most shrines is just the best option. You get such a huge power surge, like a transform x3 event for a single curse. Transforming 3 strike/defends for a curse is almost always worth it unless you low roll on transform, but there are very few things that are worse than a strike/defend.
yeah for sure
the duplicate 2x with +1 curse is another ridiculous one
Oh yeah especially on guardian where you also duplicate any socketed gems
oh yeah for sure, auto is another because the basic cards are bomb
so you dont ever even need a bit of setup, just getting that event wins runs
I wouldn't say outright wins the run, but makes it considerably easier, yes
yeah you need 1-2 of the commons 😂
but that's another whole discussion
A second go-to can hurt in act 1, but beyond that you always want ut
good events are really good in downfall for sure
